qas.question: Who was an important figure in the twentieth-century Islamic revival in India?
Maududi was trained as a lawyer, but chose what professional for himself instead?
When did Maududi found the Jamaat-e-Islami party?
Who was an important early figure in the Islamic revival in India?
Though trained as a lawyer, what profession did Maududi pursue instead?
Where did Maududi exert the most impact?
Where did Maududi's books place Islam?
Who was not an important figure in the twentieth-century Islamic revival in India?
Maududi was trained as a lawyer, but chose what religion for himself instead?
When did Maududi leave the Jamaat-e-Islami party?
Where did Maududi exert the least impact?
Where did Maududi's books not place Islam?

context: <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>Sayyid Abul Ala Maududi<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> was an important early twentieth-century figure in the Islamic revival in India, and then after independence from Britain, in Pakistan. Trained as a lawyer he chose the profession of <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b8_0>journalism<b8_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, and wrote about contemporary issues and most importantly about Islam and Islamic law. Maududi founded the Jamaat-e-Islami party in <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b9_0>1941<b9_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> and remained its leader until 1972. However, Maududi had much more impact <a5_0><b10_0>through his <a5_1><a5_2>writing<b10_0/><a5_2/><a5_1/><a5_0/> than through his political organising. His extremely influential books (translated into many languages) placed Islam <b11_0>in <a6_0><a6_1>a <a6_2>modern context<b11_0/><a6_2/><a6_1/><a6_0/>, and influenced not only conservative ulema but liberal modernizer Islamists such as al-Faruqi, whose "Islamization of Knowledge" carried forward some of Maududi's key principles.
